name: UnidenSolo
0:
”Alexa, show the front door camera.”
”Alexa, show the living room camera.”
”Alexa, stop the camera.”
skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Developer Terms of Use
des:
Enable the Uniden Solo Skill in your Alexa App, and you can check-in on your property by simply saying “Alexa, show the front door.”

Please note that you are only able to view video steam and listen to audio from your Uniden Solo+ Camera; you will not 

be able to speak to people through your Echo Show. 

To get started, simply tap the “Enable” button, link your Alexa account to your Uniden Solo account. After linking your Uniden Solo account and discovering your Uniden Solo+ cameras in your Alexa account, you can start streaming video to your Echo Show or Echo Spot with commands like:
 - "Alexa, show the front camera"
 - "Alexa, show the living room camera "

To stop your Uniden Solo+ camera from streaming video, you can say:
- "Alexa, stop the front camera"

When using this Skill, you need to specify the name of the desired camera. The name is equivalent to the device name of your camera and can be found and configured in the Uniden Solo app. You can also add Uniden Solo+ cameras to new or existing groups in the Alexa app。
